<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Covid-19 update: </strong></span><span>Let’s head overseas, where UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson said there’s “</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-22/u-k-says-new-variant-may-be-linked-to-higher-death-rates?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some evidence</a></span><span>” the new coronavirus variant, B117, is deadlier than the original strain (we already know it’s more contagious). In better news, it appears that the UK’s total Covid case numbers are on a downward trajectory.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>The stock market winner this week was the Nasdaq, which posted a </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/21/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">healthy gain of 4.2%</a></span><span>. A Big Week for Big Tech had a lot to do with it.  </span>
</li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/22/covid19-vaccine-big-businesses-volunteer-help-speed-distribution?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Businesses to Biden
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Tom Cruise saying "Help me, help you"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fdLR6LGwAiVNhGQNvf/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='Tom Cruise saying "Help me, help you"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fdLR6LGwAiVNhGQNvf/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Executives from major US corporations are eagerly raising their hands at the front of class hoping to get called on by President Biden. The problem they think they can answer? How to speed up a vaccine rollout that is wayyyy behind schedule.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>New York State was set to </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-22/cuomo-says-new-york-will-run-out-of-vaccine-allocation-today?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">run out of vaccine doses</a></span><span> yesterday, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said. And just 67% of hospital staff (who are in the first priority tier) have received shots. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Elsewhere in the country, about half of the 38 million doses distributed to states are stuck in freezers.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A few notable hand-raisers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Walmart, which is already vaccinating healthcare workers in Arkansas and New Mexico, is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/22/walmart-expands-vaccinations-in-a-boost-to-the-us-covid-prevention-program.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expanding</a> its vaccine efforts to seven additional states, Chicago, and Puerto Rico. Eventually, the nation’s largest retailer thinks it can dole out 10 million to 13 million doses a month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over in Washington state, Starbucks, Microsoft, and Costco have all been tapped by Washington Gov. Jay Inslee to <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/01/22/retailers-coronavirus-vaccine-distribution/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">help distribute vaccines</a>. And this week, Amazon<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>implored the Biden administration to call upon its expertise for something a little more pressing than delivering a Ninja food processor in less than 12 hours. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Private sector <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/handshake_1f91d.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> public sector </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Big retailers, working more closely with local governments, could be a missing link in the distribution effort’s 10,000-piece puzzle. “Their core businesses are already geared around serving millions of customers day in and day out. They have locations right across the country and...national distribution and logistics networks,” Neil Saunders, managing director of Global Data Retail, told the Washington Post.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not just the big kids helping out, either. Carbon Health, a healthcare startup that just finished raising a Series C round, now powers <a href="https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-vaccine-logistics-companies-beda614c-e8f4-42b6-8c88-0824a3e80f9b.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the back-end tech</a> for the City of Los Angeles’s entire vaccine program. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The private sector has every incentive to help out the government. “Our economy will not recover, and we won’t be able to get people back into the office, until we have good penetration of the vaccines,” Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-22/wall-street-presses-new-york-to-let-it-help-speed-up-vaccines?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/22/retail-traders-shortsellers-clash-gamestop?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
GameStop Can’t Stop, Won’t Stop
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The army of amateur retail traders that fueled past rallies in stocks like Kodak and Hertz has a new favorite plaything: GameStop. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the video game retailer’s stock shot up <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/gamestop-stock-price-retail-traders-shorts-citron-andrew-left-gme-2021-1-1029994276?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as much as 78%</a>, triggering four separate trade stoppages so everyone could catch their breath.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> GameStop popped on investors’ radar after it added the cofounder of e-commerce pet brand Chewy <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/13/wework-gamestop-turning-corner?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to its board</a> 10 days ago. Its stock surged 60% that day which, in turn, caught the eye of notorious short-seller Citron Research. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Citron, which makes money if GameStop’s stock flops, released a video on Thursday outlining why it thinks GameStop is overvalued. “This is a failing mall-based retailer," the firm’s managing partner Andrew Left said in the video. Amateur traders took it as a challenge and promptly sent the stock soaring, racking up losses for anyone who holds a short position.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The amateur investors are winning for now—the stock is up 245% this month. But unless GameStop can prove its e-comm transformation is legit, they might not have the upperhand for long. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/22/existing-home-sales-2020-hit-highest-level-14-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Selling Sunsets on 2020
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="nice house" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODE4L25pY2VfaG91c2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After ticking up 0.7% in December, US existing home sales in 2020 clocked in at their <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/22/existing-home-sales-in-2020-were-highest-since-in-over-a-decade.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest level</a> in 14 years. What juiced the housing market last year? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Historically low borrowing costs:</strong></span><span> The 30-year fixed-rate home loan </span><span><a href="https://www.seattletimes.com/business/us-long-term-mortgage-rates-slip-30-year-loan-at-2-77/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell to 2.77%</a></span><span> this week. It stood at 3.60% a year ago. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Coronavirus lockdowns: </strong></span><span>After months of being cooped up in an apartment with young kids, you weren’t the only one thinking, “I gotta get a bigger place.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s the crazy part: </strong>Home sales could have been much higher—if only there were more homes to sell. 1.07 million homes were on the market at the end of December, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-existing-home-sales-reach-highest-level-in-14-years-11611327933?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">23% fewer</a> than December 2019.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s pushing up prices</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The median price on an existing home was $309,800 in December, 13% higher than a year earlier. When you look closely, you’ll see that the <em>higher</em> end of the market is doing most of the heavy lifting.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Sales of homes <$100,000: </strong></span><span>down 15% annually</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">$500,000–$750,000: </strong></span><span>up 65%</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">$1,000,000+: </strong></span><span>up 94%</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What these numbers show: </strong>If you made it through the pandemic unscathed, like many in the higher-income brackets did, you tried to level up your crib. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/22/google-parent-alphabet-shuts-loon?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Goodnight Loon
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Loon balloon" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODIyL2xvb25fYmFsbG9vbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google parent Alphabet is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-parent-ends-project-that-provided-internet-from-balloons-11611327810?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shutting down</a> Loon, its ambitious attempt to bring wi-fi to remote areas via high-flying balloons. The reason: Big dreams need big budgets. Too big.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The project’s leader, Alaistair Westgarth, explained in a </span><span><a href="https://medium.com/loon-for-all/loon-draft-c3fcebc11f3f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a></span><span>, “While we’ve found a number of willing partners along the way, we haven’t found a way to get the costs low enough to build a long-term, sustainable business.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It was cool while it lasted: </strong>The tennis-court-sized balloons supplied internet service to an area 200x the range of a standard cell tower, with zero pretense of being pine trees. In 2017, Loon balloons <a href="https://www.engadget.com/2017-11-09-project-loon-delivers-internet-100-000-people-puerto-rico.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restored</a> wireless service to over 100,000 Puerto Ricans following Hurricane Maria.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Loon was part of Alphabet’s “Other Bets” segment, which incubated moonshot projects like self-driving car company Waymo and life sciences research organization Verily. “Other Bets” consistently records chunky operating losses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>CEO Sundar Pichai has been pruning financially risky projects in an attempt to pull the company’s gaze down from the clouds to its bottom line.</p>

<img alt="App viewership numbers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODIxL2FwcF92aWV3ZXJzaGlwX251bWJlcnMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>App Annie</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TikTok rose past Facebook to become the most time-consuming social media app in 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to <a href="https://www.appannie.com/en/go/state-of-mobile-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">App Annie</a>, users spent an average of 21.5 hours on TikTok per month, 325% more than last year. All of the top five social media platforms experienced an uptick from 2019–2020, but none as dramatic as TikTok’s. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Consider: <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/amp/tag/snailtok?lang=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">#Snailtok</a> alone, a hashtag full of snail videos, has over 24.3 million views. (For the record, our favorite snail influencer is <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@slimetownusa?lang=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slimetownusa</a>.)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tax Season 2021: Important Facts and Figures
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/tax-guide?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tax illustration" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjc0L3RheF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Wang</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>This article is part of our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/tax-guide?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ongoing series</a> on taxes and the gig economy.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Deadlines: </strong>The IRS delayed the start of tax season till February 12. In a normal year, the IRS typically starts accepting and processing last year’s tax returns in late January, but…yeah. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>We’re still on for the traditional April 15 tax filing deadline, which was extended until July last year. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stimulus payments: </strong>Many Americans received cash from the government last year (known as Economic Impact Payments) to blunt the economic crisis. This stimulus money is <a href="https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/what-people-really-want-to-know-about-economic-impact-payments?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NOT subject</a> to income taxes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>If you didn’t receive 100% of the stimulus money you were entitled to, you are eligible for the “</span><span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/recovery-rebate-credit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recovery rebate credit</a></span><span>,” which will either bump up your refund or reduce your tax obligations.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Refunds: </strong>Once you file your taxes electronically, you should <a href="https://www.newsweek.com/irs-delays-opening-tax-season-what-about-april-15-deadline-1562017#:~:text=News-,IRS%20Delays%20Opening%20of%20Tax%20Season%2C%20but,About%20the%20April%2015%20Deadline%3F&text=The%20IRS%20said%20Friday%20that,processing%20last%20year's%20tax%20returns.&text=The%20delay%2C%20however%2C%20will%20not,the%20April%2015%20filing%20deadline.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expect</a> to receive your refund via direct deposit within 21 days of the filing date, the IRS said. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLet’s head overseas, where UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson said there’s “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-22/u-k-says-new-variant-may-be-linked-to-higher-death-rates?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esome evidence\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” the new coronavirus variant, B117, is deadlier than the original strain (we already know it’s more contagious). In better news, it appears that the UK’s total Covid case numbers are on a downward trajectory.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe stock market winner this week was the Nasdaq, which posted a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/21/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehealthy gain of 4.2%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. A Big Week for Big Tech had a lot to do with it.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHEALTH\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/22/covid19-vaccine-big-businesses-volunteer-help-speed-distribution?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBusinesses to Biden\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Tom Cruise saying \"Help me, help you\"\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=377 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/fdLR6LGwAiVNhGQNvf/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt='Tom Cruise saying \"Help me, help you\"' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/fdLR6LGwAiVNhGQNvf/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eExecutives from major US corporations are eagerly raising their hands at the front of class hoping to get called on by President Biden. The problem they think they can answer? How to speed up a vaccine rollout that is wayyyy behind schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNew York State was set to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-22/cuomo-says-new-york-will-run-out-of-vaccine-allocation-today?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erun out of vaccine doses\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said. And just 67% of hospital staff (who are in the first priority tier) have received shots. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eElsewhere in the country, about half of the 38 million doses distributed to states are stuck in freezers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA few notable hand-raisers\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWalmart, which is already vaccinating healthcare workers in Arkansas and New Mexico, is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/22/walmart-expands-vaccinations-in-a-boost-to-the-us-covid-prevention-program.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpanding\u003c/a\u003e its vaccine efforts to seven additional states, Chicago, and Puerto Rico. Eventually, the nation’s largest retailer thinks it can dole out 10 million to 13 million doses a month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver in Washington state, Starbucks, Microsoft, and Costco have all been tapped by Washington Gov. Jay Inslee to \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/01/22/retailers-coronavirus-vaccine-distribution/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehelp distribute vaccines\u003c/a\u003e. And this week, Amazon\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eimplored the Biden administration to call upon its expertise for something a little more pressing than delivering a Ninja food processor in less than 12 hours. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePrivate sector \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/handshake_1f91d.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e public sector \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBig retailers, working more closely with local governments, could be a missing link in the distribution effort’s 10,000-piece puzzle. “Their core businesses are already geared around serving millions of customers day in and day out. They have locations right across the country and...national distribution and logistics networks,” Neil Saunders, managing director of Global Data Retail, told the Washington Post.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not just the big kids helping out, either. Carbon Health, a healthcare startup that just finished raising a Series C round, now powers \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-vaccine-logistics-companies-beda614c-e8f4-42b6-8c88-0824a3e80f9b.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe back-end tech\u003c/a\u003e for the City of Los Angeles’s entire vaccine program. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The private sector has every incentive to help out the government. “Our economy will not recover, and we won’t be able to get people back into the office, until we have good penetration of the vaccines,” Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-22/wall-street-presses-new-york-to-let-it-help-speed-up-vaccines?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Stop\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe army of amateur retail traders that fueled past rallies in stocks like Kodak and Hertz has a new favorite plaything: GameStop. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the video game retailer’s stock shot up \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/gamestop-stock-price-retail-traders-shorts-citron-andrew-left-gme-2021-1-1029994276?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas much as 78%\u003c/a\u003e, triggering four separate trade stoppages so everyone could catch their breath.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e GameStop popped on investors’ radar after it added the cofounder of e-commerce pet brand Chewy \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/13/wework-gamestop-turning-corner?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto its board\u003c/a\u003e 10 days ago. Its stock surged 60% that day which, in turn, caught the eye of notorious short-seller Citron Research. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCitron, which makes money if GameStop’s stock flops, released a video on Thursday outlining why it thinks GameStop is overvalued. “This is a failing mall-based retailer,\" the firm’s managing partner Andrew Left said in the video. Amateur traders took it as a challenge and promptly sent the stock soaring, racking up losses for anyone who holds a short position.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe amateur investors are winning for now—the stock is up 245% this month. But unless GameStop can prove its e-comm transformation is legit, they might not have the upperhand for long. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter ticking up 0.7% in December, US existing home sales in 2020 clocked in at their \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/22/existing-home-sales-in-2020-were-highest-since-in-over-a-decade.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehighest level\u003c/a\u003e in 14 years. What juiced the housing market last year? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHistorically low borrowing costs:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The 30-year fixed-rate home loan \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.seattletimes.com/business/us-long-term-mortgage-rates-slip-30-year-loan-at-2-77/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell to 2.77%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this week. It stood at 3.60% a year ago. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCoronavirus lockdowns: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter months of being cooped up in an apartment with young kids, you weren’t the only one thinking, “I gotta get a bigger place.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHere’s the crazy part: \u003c/strong\u003eHome sales could have been much higher—if only there were more homes to sell. 1.07 million homes were on the market at the end of December, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-existing-home-sales-reach-highest-level-in-14-years-11611327933?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e23% fewer\u003c/a\u003e than December 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat’s pushing up prices\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe median price on an existing home was $309,800 in December, 13% higher than a year earlier. When you look closely, you’ll see that the \u003cem\u003ehigher\u003c/em\u003e end of the market is doing most of the heavy lifting.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSales of homes \u003c$100,000: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003edown 15% annually\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$500,000–$750,000: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eup 65%\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$1,000,000+: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eup 94%\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoogle parent Alphabet is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-parent-ends-project-that-provided-internet-from-balloons-11611327810?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshutting down\u003c/a\u003e Loon, its ambitious attempt to bring wi-fi to remote areas via high-flying balloons. The reason: Big dreams need big budgets. Too big.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe project’s leader, Alaistair Westgarth, explained in a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/loon-for-all/loon-draft-c3fcebc11f3f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblog post\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, “While we’ve found a number of willing partners along the way, we haven’t found a way to get the costs low enough to build a long-term, sustainable business.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt was cool while it lasted: \u003c/strong\u003eThe tennis-court-sized balloons supplied internet service to an area 200x the range of a standard cell tower, with zero pretense of being pine trees. In 2017, Loon balloons \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/2017-11-09-project-loon-delivers-internet-100-000-people-puerto-rico.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erestored\u003c/a\u003e wireless service to over 100,000 Puerto Ricans following Hurricane Maria.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLoon was part of Alphabet’s “Other Bets” segment, which incubated moonshot projects like self-driving car company Waymo and life sciences research organization Verily. “Other Bets” consistently records chunky operating losses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eCEO Sundar Pichai has been pruning financially risky projects in an In a normal year, the IRS typically starts accepting and processing last year’s tax returns in late January, but…yeah. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe’re still on for the traditional April 15 tax filing deadline, which was extended until July last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStimulus payments: \u003c/strong\u003eMany Americans received cash from the government last year (known as Economic Impact Payments) to blunt the economic crisis. This stimulus money is \u003ca href=\"https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/what-people-really-want-to-know-about-economic-impact-payments?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNOT subject\u003c/a\u003e to income taxes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIf you didn’t receive 100% of the stimulus money you were entitled to, you are eligible for the “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/recovery-rebate-credit?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecovery rebate credit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” which will either bump up your refund or reduce your tax obligations.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong
